result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Richard Ray Rodriguez

records.addlTxt: Received and Filed.Pretrial Services Status Report 11.3.22
Received and Filed. Pretrial Services Violation Report 10.14.22

Defendant Richard Ray Rodriguez in court.  Attorney Colin Patrick McGinn in court for Richard Ray Rodriguez.  Prosecuting attorney Abby Rockendorf appeared in court on behalf of Patrick T. Franken for the State of Wisconsin. 
Case in court for Status Conference. Parties provide an update to the court. Case is no longer on a global resolution track. Court thereby orders case adjourned for a plea and sentencing hearing before Br 16.
Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for February 3, 2023 at 11:00 am.
Received and Filed. Pretrial Services Supervision Report 10.12.22

Defendant Richard Ray Rodriguez appeared by video.  Attorney Colin Patrick McGinn appeared by video for Richard Ray Rodriguez.  Attorney Abby Rockendorf in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Case in court for scheduling conference. Defense received discovery but no offer; defense requested adjournment due to case possibly going to drug treatment court. Court granted defense's request. Court ordered case adjourned for status conference in Branch 16; VIA ZOOM. Status conference scheduled for October 12, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Received and Filed. Pretrial Services Supervision Report 9-19-2022
Received and Filed. Pretrial Services Violation Report 9.9.22

Defendant Richard Ray Rodriguez in court with attorney Colin Patrick McGinn.  Alexander C. Dyer appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case in court to address Justice Point violation. Court admonishes the defendant, but does not amend bail. Court further sets 09/16/2022 deadline to file any motions. Case remains calendared for a scheduling conference on 09/20/2022 at 10:00 am before Br 16.
Received and Filed. Pretrial Services Violation Report 8.17.22

Defendant Richard Ray Rodriguez in court with Attorney Colin Patrick McGinn; both appear by video.  Abby Rockendorf appeared in person for the State of Wisconsin.  
Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the State: Milwaukee County Sheriff Deputy Y. Vang. State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and plead not guilty.  Case is adjourned to Branch 16.  Scheduling conference scheduled for September 20, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Received and Filed. Pretrial Services Supervision Report 8-4-22
Received and Filed. Public Defender Order Appointing Counsel

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION Level 5.
  Court ordered random drug testing.
  Court ordered Defendant to maintain ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY.
  No possession of any controlled substance without a valid prescription.
No driving at all.
  No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.

Defendant Richard Ray Rodriguez in court with attorney Katherine Elizabeth Holloway.  Defendant Richard Ray Rodriguez in custody.  Karine O'Byrne appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   All parties appeared by video conference.
  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Grayson, Branch 16. Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for August 10, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
